did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs [c.1912?]
did.langmaterial: This collection does not contain text- or script-based material.
did.abstract: This scrapbook page contains five photographs taken in and around the Byllesby Dam in Carroll County, Virginia.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs, Ms2009-095, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs were purchased by Special Collections in 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs commenced and was completed in June 2009.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The construction and naming of the Byllesby Dam was completed between 1912 and 1913. The dam is named after H.M. Byllesby and Company–a Chicago-based investment firm that assisted in the creation of the Appalachian Power Company. The dam has a surface area of 242 acres and is a source of hydroelectric power for the surrounding area. During the construction of the Byllesby Dam, the Appalachian Power Company also built another dam at Buck–three miles downstream from the Byllesby Dam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook page contains five photographs taken in and around the Byllesby Dam in Carroll County, Virginia. While the photographs on the scrapbook page are not labeled, one photograph is of the dam. Another photograph shows two women standing on the dam. The third photograph on this particular page shows a small building marked "Byllesby" directly beside a set of railroad tracks. On the opposite side of this scrapbook page are two photographs of children–one standing in front of a car with a license plate from Wytheville and the other standing in front of what appears to be a temporary campground with tents and a cot.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type.

odd.head: Rights Statements for Archival Description
odd.p: The guide to the Byllesby Dam, Carroll County, Virginia, Photographs by Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, is licensed under a CC0 (https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Byllesby, Virginia, Dam Construction Photograph Album (Ms2019-028). Finding aid available online.
